intro: Neoevansia striata, commonly known as the striped evansia, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a shrub native to the arid regions of South America, particularly Argentina and Chile. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, narrow leaves with a striated appearance, giving it its common name. It produces small, clustered yellow flowers that are often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. Neoevansia striata is adapted to survive in dry conditions, with a deep root system and succulent stems that store water.
